item.title: Naive Bayes
item.description: Introduction In Bayesian statistics there are two important concepts, we use probabilities to measure the uncertainty about the parameters used by the probability distributions, and we use the Bayes´ theorem to update those probabilities.

item.title: Basic probability concepts
item.description: Introduction In this series of articles, We’ll dig deep into understanding Bayesian inference, starting from the basics.
